com.att.aro.videocapture
Class DataAtomOutputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.OutputStream
      java.io.FilterOutputStream
          com.att.aro.videocapture.DataAtomOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
public class DataAtomOutputStream
extends java.io.FilterOutputStream

Represents an output stream filter that supports the common data types used inside of QuickTime Data Atoms.

Field Summary
protected static long MAC_TIMESTAMP_EPOCH
          The Mac Epoch format timestamp value.
protected  long written
          The current number of bytes written to the data output stream.

Field Detail

MAC_TIMESTAMP_EPOCH

protected static final long MAC_TIMESTAMP_EPOCH
The Mac Epoch format timestamp value.

written

protected long written
The current number of bytes written to the data output stream. If this counter overflows, it will be wrapped to Integer.MAX_VALUE.

writeType

public void writeType(java.lang.String s)
               throws java.io.IOException
Writes a 4 byte Atom Type identifier to the output stream.

Parameters:
s - The Atom Type identifier to be written. A string with a length of 4 characters.

java.io.IOException

writeByte

public final void writeByte(int v)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Writes a byte to the underlying output stream as a 1 byte value. If no exception is thrown, the byte counter is incremented by 1.

Parameters:
v - The byte value to be written.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
See Also:
FilterOutputStream.out

write

public void write(byte[] b,
                  int off,
                  int len)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the specified number of bytes from a byte array to the underlying output stream, starting at the specified offset. If no exception is thrown, the number of bytes written (the byte counter) is incremented by the value of the len parameter.

Overrides:
write in class java.io.FilterOutputStream
Parameters:
b - The array of bytes to write to the output stream.
off - The offset in the array to begin writing from.
len - The number of bytes to write from the array.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
See Also:
FilterOutputStream.out

write

public void write(int b)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the specified byte (the low eight bits of the int parameter b) to the underlying output stream. If no exception is thrown, the byte counter is incremented by 1.This method implements the write method of the underlying OutputStream class.

Overrides:
write in class java.io.FilterOutputStream
Parameters:
b - The byte to be written.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
See Also:
FilterOutputStream.out

writeInt

public void writeInt(int v)
              throws java.io.IOException
Writes an int value to the underlying output stream as four bytes. The high byte is written first. If no exception is thrown, the byte counter is incremented by 4.

Parameters:
v - The int value to be written.

java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

incCount

protected void incCount(int value)
Increases the written counter by the specified value until it reaches Long.MAX_VALUE.

Parameters:
value - - The value to increase the written counter.

size

public final long size()
Returns the current value of the counter written, the number of bytes written to this data output stream so far. If the counter overflows, it will be wrapped to Integer.MAX_VALUE.

Returns:
the value of the written field.
See Also:
DataOutputStream.written
